paper_abstract: Fuzzy language recognizability via finite monoids (called m-recognizability) is examined. Fuzzy languages computed by (max, min)-automata, (max, Delta(L))-automata and (max, Delta(D))-automata are m-recognizable (Delta(L), Delta(D) are the Lucasiewicz intersection and the drastic intersection, respectively). The syntactic monoid associated to each m-recognizable language can be effectively constructed. Thus, the equality of two m-recognizable fuzzy languages is decidable. A pumping lemma is displayed. paper_title: On the recognizability of Fuzzy languages I
